main event: Rapidly-flashing lights observed on the horizon, tracked on radar and also visually observed.
interesting points: The duration of the sighting was reported as around 15 minutes, but the witness could only have observed it for 2-3 minutes at most.
The rapid flashing of the lights is unexplained and may have been multiple objects rather than a single one.
The object was observed on radar and reported to the Control Operator.
The witness was a researcher and development engineer who worked in physics from 1946-1955.
The object appeared to be some distance away and very high, with a peculiar 'dancing' motion of the flashing light before disappearing.
